gov.usgs.anss.util

Class RTSUtilityCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.util.RTSUtilityCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class RTSUtilityCommand
extends java.lang.Thread
    RTSUtilityCommand.java - creates a thread which attempts to keep a socket connected to an IP address passed at creation. This object then has entry points for issuing RTS commands down that socket. This implements both RTS command to the USGS SocketServer and command to the port 4606 provided by RedBoot and the SocketServer

    • Constructor Detail

      • RTSUtilityCommand

        public RTSUtilityCommand(java.lang.String ip)
        Creates a new instance of RTSUtilityCommand on the give IP address. This routine creates a thread which constantly keeps a socket to the IP address open to the RTS Utility server command port (RTSServer on gldmt). Various methods to this object then can issue commands on this socket to the server which forwards them to the station.
        Parameters:
        ip - The IP address i

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the socket associated with this object and shutdown the connect thread.

      • run

        public void run()
        Keeps a socket to the IP address open. If any errors occur, causes a new socket to be made. If the close() routine is called, the shutdown variable is set and the next problem on the socket causes this thread to exit. The target IP is the command server RTSServer normally
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • getText

        public java.lang.StringBuffer getText()
        There is a StringBuffer which keeps appending information about the progress of command, errors, or other inforation this routine needs to return to the users of its methods.
        Returns:
        The accumulated messages, errors and status as text

        public java.lang.String setOverride(java.lang.String ipadr,
                                    short rate)
        Send a SocketServer send Override command to the RTS at IP address given.
        Parameters:

      • setUsgsType

        public java.lang.String setUsgsType(java.lang.String ipadr,
                                    int serial,
                                    int type,
                                    java.lang.String ip,
                                    java.lang.String ipalt,
                                    int port,
                                    boolean client)
        Send a SocketServer USGS Port Type command to the RTS at IP address given.
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address of the target RTS
        serial - The serial port number
        type - The USGS type of port
        ip - The IP address associated with this serial port
        ipalt - The alternate IP address associated with this serial port
        port - THe IP port assocatiated with this serial port
        client - True, RTS is client and will originate the socket
        Returns:
        The string with error information (normally write error to socket)

      • setRtsMode

        public java.lang.String setRtsMode(java.lang.String ipadr,
                                   boolean mode)
        Send a SocketServer RTS Mode command to the RTS at IP address given.
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address of the target RTS
        mode - Boolean, if true, the RTS port will start a TCP/IP connect (be a client)
        Returns:
        The string with error information (normally write error to socket)
